ARABIC: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: eyes downcast, darkened by debasement, that will be the Day which they were promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Eyes lowered, shame attending. That is the day they have been promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Their eyes will be downcast and disgrace will overwhelm them. Such is the Day that they were promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: with their eyes cast down and covered by disgrace; the day about which they were promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: With lowered eyes, disgrace overcoming them; this is the day, which they had been promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: With their eyes lowered in fear and humility, ignominy covering them (all over)! That is the Day which they were promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Their eyes cast down; disgrace shall overtake them; that is the day which they were threatened with.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: humbled their eyes, overspreading them abasement. That is the day which they were promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: With eyes aghast, abasement stupefying them: Such is the Day which they are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: with downcast eyes and faces distorted in shame; such is the Day which they are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Downcast shall be their looks; abjectness shall overspread them. Such is the Day which they are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: with a humbled look [in their eyes], overcast by abasement. That is the day they had been promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Their eyes lowered in dejection,- ignominy covering them (all over)! such is the Day the which they are promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: With their eyes lowered in fear and humility, ignominy covering them (all over)! That is the Day which they were promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: their eyes are humbled and they are covered with humiliation. Such is the Day that they were promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Their eyes cast down; overwhelmed by humiliation. This is the Day which they were promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:44] with their eyes humbled, abject, overcast by abasement, shrouded in it. Such is the day which they are promised (dhālika is the subject and what follows it is the predicate), meaning: the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (With eyes) that see no goodness (aghast) humiliated, (abasement stupefying them) grief and darkness appear on their faces: (Such is the Day which they are promised) such is the Day in which they were promised chastisement; and this day is the Day of Judgement. And this promise is like the promise and warning of Noah'. And of the surah in which Noah is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 28 verses, 224 words and 929 letters: Surah 71: Noah (Nuh) And of the surah in which Noah is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 28 verses, 224 words and 929 letters:
